and now i want to share a few don'ts
don't
expect to be spoon-feeded don't get

people ask you for more details someone

you are doing it wrong and you can

so the second key rule is practice of 15
minute rule
take 15 minutes to solve the problem in
any way you can however if you don't
have an answer after 15 minutes
you must ask someone because if you keep
escalating bugs without even trying to
figure it out
you're never going to learn how to solve

for yourself when you are going to ask
for help you are at least
armed with the full context of the

the third thing is explain what you are

big picture goal because if you're
secretive about
what you're doing people might assume
that it's your work assignment
or maybe you're working on some
commercial or it could be anything else
also don't say i try to run
xyz it didn't work please help
you won't get any response or if you do
they will likely to be sarcastic and

if you're very lucky someone might say i

there are a lot of very clever and

also whenever you are explaining things

don't say i think delete i think
say whatever you want to say without

i think
the fourth thing is say what you have

the fifth thing is say thanks and give

but if you can let people know their

this is their reward it's also an

they will likely to be there for you
